arts.ttl: Mark Robins spells out big Stoke City hope after massive first win
arts.sum: I think really where we are at, at the moment, we are in a situation when we haven't won games so there's a bit of a lack of confidence or belief or a mixture of both. Mark Robins hopes that his first league win as Stoke City manager will give his young squad the confidence to ‘let the handbrake off’ and show what they can do.

arts.ttl: Stoke City transfer latest as Mark Robins draws FFP red line before deadline day
arts.sum: Stoke have been buoyed by a 2-1 win at league rivals Hull as they head into deadline day – the first league win under Robins – when they were missing eight players and had Lynden Gooch limp out of action in the first half. Robins said after the Hull win: "I'm still hopeful.

arts.ttl: Hull City boss Ruben Selles makes intriguing transfer admission ahead of deadline day
arts.sum: Prime target Charlie Taylor is unlikely to arrive at the club, and despite that setback, the Tigers head coach hasn't ruled out adding to that area to provide competition for Matty Jacob and Sean McLoughlin. Already seven players have arrived at the MKM Stadium in the January window, but Selles hasn't ruled out a late addition or two, including on the left side of defence, which has been a problem area all season.

arts.ttl: Stoke City player ratings vs Hull as Andrew Moran earn priceless first win for Mark Robins
arts.sum: Al-Hamadi made a bright start to the second half too and he raced in from the right to set up Wilson-Esbrand to surely put Stoke 2-1 up – except Drameh somehow sneaked in to get the vital touch under the crossbar to whack it clear. A short break in play after Lowe took a whack gave Stoke a chance to reorganise slightly and try to settle things down – although there was soon more reorganisation needed because Gooch was limping off to be replaced by Tchamadeu while Viktor Johansson also needed physio treatment after feeling his hamstring after racing out of the box to deal with a looping pass.

arts.ttl: Hull City player ratings as Jacob and Drameh struggle in damaging Stoke City defeat
arts.sum: The Tigers, who are quickly becoming fast starters under Ruben Selles, took a sixth-minute lead when Sean McLoughlin headed down a clever Steven Alzate cross into the path of Eliot Matazo to turn in from a tight angle. Abu Kamara: Warmed the palms of the goalkeeper early on and teed up Pedro for a good chance, was taken off for Louie Barry in the second half.

arts.ttl: Hull City suffer yet more MKM Stadium misery against Stoke City
arts.sum: Mark Robins side started the brighter of the two in truth, but it was the hosts who grabbed the precious first goal when a clever move earned City a corner, from which Stoke failed to deal with a short routine, Steven Alzate clipped in a lovely ball which McLoughlin attacked, and after a scramble, Matazo turned in from close range, albeit at a tight angle. The Tigers hit the front early when Stoke failed to clear a well-worked corner routine, and McLoughlin headed towards goal and on his home debut, Eliot Matazo turned in from close range.

arts.ttl: Andrew Moran hits winner for Stoke at fellow strugglers Hull
arts.sum: Ali Al-Hamadi had cancelled out Eliot Matazo’s opener for the hosts.

arts.ttl: Stoke City team news vs Hull as Mark Robins makes four changes
arts.sum: Tatsuki Seko, Bae Junho, Josh Wilson-Esbrand and Al-Hamadi come into the starting XI while Junior Tchamadeu, Andrew Moran and Lewis Koumas drop to the bench. We’ve got to try to entertain people, keep them coming and wanting to come.

arts.ttl: Hull vs Stoke City live - Team news from MKM Stadium - Stoke-on-Trent Live
arts.sum: Mark Robins is heading into his second month as Stoke manager looking to build on a first few weeks that have seen one win, three draws and one defeat, with the victory coming in the FA Cup third round at Sunderland. Hull manager Ruben Selles has been in situ for about three more weeks than Robins and has started to see an upturn in fortunes with four wins in eight games before this weekend.

arts.ttl: Every player linked with Stoke City so far in challenging transfer window
arts.sum: Stoke were linked with the Birmingham captain Krystian Bielik but he is not a player who is believed to have been up for discussion this month, either leaving his current club or going elsewhere. The 32-year-old has already been linked with interest Blackburn Rovers, Alex Neil's Millwall and Preston North End. Schlupp is also reported to be liked by Major League Soccer (MLS) clubs as well, including San Diego FC and Charlotte FC.
